question: I get many thoughts of doubt and shirkh, will I be forgiven.
answer:
QUESTION
Assalamualaikum brother. I have a question on doubt and Shirkh. Firstly I am aware that shirkh and Disbelief are not forgiven (Please correct me if Im wrong). Recently many doubts are creeping into my mind and sometimes I am doubting the existence of Allah and all sorts of other thoughts are coming into my mind (I have seen this du'a 'Laa Howla Wa Laa Qouwwatta Illa Billah' can you translate it to English for me please) sometimes I am searching for answers and think thoughts of Shirkh. So is it that Allah will not forgive me for sometimes thinking that or is it that if I die on this thought I will not be forgiven and If I die without this thought I will be forgiven. I know reverts are forgiven after taking the Shahadah but will I be forgiven after realising the truth again. I can't help thinking that I will not be forgiven and that my soul is doomed for eternity, how can I except this. I am in great need of answers. Also, sometimes thoughts of shirhk like giving others than Allah the attributes of Allah come into my head, when I know that only Allah can hold these attributes, for example I might say someone's name and then say Subahanatuallah but I know that this is wrong and dont mean it. So will I be forgiven. Jazakallahir for your time and effort. Salam.
ANSWER
